title: Agency Roster

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to all sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

Please note that the duty to comply with requests for records extends to those records that exist and are in the possession, custody, or control of the custodian of records at the time of the request. See M.G.L. c. 66, section 10(a)(ii). In addition, 32 Op. Att’y Gen 157, 165 (May 18, 1977) held that a custodian is not obligated to create a record in response to a request for information. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Worcester

title: Puerto Rico FEMA Catastrophic Hurricane Plan (FEMA Region 2)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Here is a link to a previously filed and completed FOIA request about Puerto Rico's FEMA Catastrophic Disaster Plan: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/puerto-rico-fema-catastrophic-hurricane-plan-45627/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) The most recent Catastrophic Hurricane Plan, often called a "hurricane annex," for Puerto Rico produced by FEMA. To aid in your search, a version of this document published in 2014 had the title "FEMA Region II Hurricane Annex for Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands." The document can be found here: https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/publications/FEMA%20Region%20II%20Hurricane%20Annex%20for%20Puerto%20Rico%20and%20US%20Virgin%20Islands-%20Oc....pdf

Keywords: "Hurricane Annex" and "FEMA Region II"

This request is for all records produced from January 1, 2018 to the date this request is processed. Please send records to me on a rolling basis. Please omit any duplicate records.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. Documents procured from this request will be used in the course of reporting about Puerto Rico's catastrophe preparedness for Heavy Weather, an independent newsletter about Puerto Rico: heavyweather.ghost.io

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: Jacob Walter 2018 Rape Case (County Clerk)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records related to the resolved portions of the case involving Jacob Walter (Case No. 19-CR-00028), which pertains to allegations of rape. Specifically, I am seeking any publicly available materials, such as indictments, affidavits, police reports, and transcripts or footage of interrogations, for charges or counts that have been adjudicated. I understand that some parts of this case may still be active, and I am not requesting records related to those unresolved aspects. If any part of this request pertains to active or exempt portions, I would greatly appreciate guidance on modifying my request to focus on accessible records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ore Adebanjo

title: Policies and communications re: art installation

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications between Brian Noland and any elected official between November 10 and December 9, 2024.

2. Any communications sent to or by the Office of Government Relations (including any of its staff members) and sent to or by any elected official concerning the FL3TCHER Exhibit. This request is limited to communications between November 10 and December 9, 2024.

3. Any contract, agreement, or policies concerning the persons or entities responsible for the FL3TCHER Exhibit. (This request should not be construed as seeking a search of records held by the persons or entities responsible for the FL3TCHER Exhibit, but instead limited to records held by the university administration.)

4. Any policies concerning  the use of (or the availability of) the Reece Museum space for art installations, exhibits, or events. This request is limited to policies in place or used since January 1, 2024.

5. Any contracts between the Reece Museum and any curator or artist since January 1, 2022.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Records Pertaining to Complaint #542283-VPS and Associated Actions (U.s. Department Of Justice)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act Request
Date: December 10, 2024
To: FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit
U.S. Department of Justice
Room 115, LOC Building
Washington, DC 20530-0001
Email: MRUFOIA.Requests@usdoj.gov

Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Complaint #542283-VPS and Associated Actions

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I hereby request access to all records, documentation, and communications related to the processing, review, decision-making, and actions taken in connection with complaint #542283-VPS, submitted on December 2, 2024. This request includes records addressing allegations of systemic constitutional violations, ADA non-compliance, whistleblower retaliation, and associated governance issues.

Scope of Request
Complaint Review and Processing:

All internal records, including memos, emails, meeting notes, decision logs, and evaluations, documenting the review and disposition of complaint #542283-VPS.
Any workflows or internal task assignments related to this complaint, including timelines and responsible personnel.
External and Interagency Communications:

Correspondence between DOJ and external entities, including the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), the Connecticut Attorney General’s Office, and other federal or state agencies concerning the subject matter of the complaint.
Interagency directives or advisories relating to oversight or collaboration on systemic issues identified in the complaint.
Policy, Procedure, and Action Records:

Documentation of DOJ protocols, policies, or operational guidelines used in assessing, addressing, or dismissing complaint #542283-VPS.
Records of enforcement actions, case follow-ups, or formal referrals stemming from the complaint.
Personnel Involvement:

Identification of all DOJ personnel involved in processing or overseeing this matter, including their roles, decision-making authority, and communication logs.
Legal and Procedural Basis:

Any legal analyses, internal opinions, or statutory references justifying the decision communicated to me in your letter dated December 2, 2024, indicating no further action would be taken.
Supporting documentation outlining the DOJ's compliance with whistleblower protection standards, ADA obligations, and constitutional governance in this decision.
ADA and Whistleblower Protections:

All DOJ records, policies, and communications addressing ADA accommodations or whistleblower protections as applied in this case.
Documentation of any DOJ awareness, training, or application of ADA-compliant processes related to this complaint.
Accommodations Previously Requested
The following accommodations, explicitly outlined in prior communications, remain unfulfilled:

Exclusive Use of MuckRock Platform

Requested: All communications must be routed exclusively through the MuckRock platform. No external portals, password-protected links, or alternate communication methods are acceptable.
Non-Compliance: Communications have directed me to use external portals and password-protected links, violating ADA guidelines and my explicit requests.
Accessible Document Formatting

Requested: All documents must be provided as screen-reader compatible PDFs, properly labeled and indexed for ease of navigation and accessibility.
Non-Compliance: Provided documents have not adhered to accessibility standards, preventing effective access to critical information.
Simplified Summaries for Complex Records

Requested: Simplified summaries must accompany all complex or technical records to enhance comprehension and ensure equitable participation.
Non-Compliance: No summaries have been provided, creating unnecessary barriers to understanding the records.
Identification of Responsible Personnel

Requested: Each communication must include the name, title, and role of the individual responsible for processing or responding to my requests.
Non-Compliance: Correspondence has consistently lacked this information, hindering accountability and effective follow-up.

Immediate Action Required

Request for Expedited Processing
Given the significant public interest in transparency regarding whistleblower retaliation, ADA compliance, and constitutional violations, expedited processing is requested under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). Immediate access to these records is essential to addressing ongoing harm and systemic governance issues.

Request for Fee Waiver
As this request is made in the public interest and not for commercial purposes, I request a fee waiver under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). Disclosure of these records will contribute substantially to public understanding of government operations and decision-making.

Deadline and Compliance Expectations
I anticipate your acknowledgment of this request within the statutory 20 business days and fulfillment of the request without undue delay. Any refusal to provide responsive records must be accompanied by a detailed justification citing specific statutory exemptions.

Failure to comply with FOIA obligations or provide the requested accommodations will necessitate escalation through administrative appeals, formal complaints to oversight bodies, and judicial remedies.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
DB.42.131.Inf.
ABI Resources https://www.ctbraininjury.com/blog/tags/db-42-131-inf https://x.com/ABIresources/status/1866212331279339765 https://www.youtube.com/@ABI.RESOURCES-CT-ABI-MFP-CARE/videos?view=0&sort=dd&shelf_id=2


CC:

U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
Connecticut Attorney General’s Office
Relevant Congressional Oversight Committees

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of bulletins and alerts generated, sent or received mentioning or describing "Brian Thompson",  or threats related to "United Health". You may limit this request to records created between December 1, 2024 and the date of the processing of this request [Inclusive]. 

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as The Intercept, MuckRock, Motherboard, The Nation, The New Republic among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: George W. Bush Library: WHTV Tapes of February 26th 2003 Heydar Aliyev - Bush Meeting in Oval Office

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: George W. Bush Library: WHTV Tapes of February 26th 2003 Heydar Aliyev - Bush Meeting in Oval Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

White House Communications Agency video footage (WHTV content) filmed during Azerbaijani President Heydar Aliyev and President George W Bush's February 26th 2003 "photo op" press and photographer availability in the Oval Office.  This is a request to review all footage from that Oval Office meeting, including outtakes and rushes.

While there are photographs of the meeting online, I am unable to find any video. Here's an image from that day: https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/president-george-w-bush-meets-with-president-heydar-aliyev-news-photo/525613918

I respectfully ask that released video from this meeting be uploaded to the @GWBLibrary YouTube page, as has been done with other requests. Thank you, and I look forward to working with you in having this request fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: History and other Cadet Course materials

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: History and other Cadet Course materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to the concept, development, preparation, coordination for and conduct of and any activities relating to the HI300 - United States Constitutional History, HI306 "Religion and Warfare in Nineteenth Century United States History, “American Civic Experience” (or its current name) course, “The Civil War and Reconstruction,” “History of the South from 1865,” “19th Century South Africa,” “Africa in Pre and Modern Times,” “The Old South,” and “The African-American Experience.” This includes, without limitation, related courseware being developed and/or taught with all records relating to BOV review and approval of these instructions. This request also includes, without limitation, all records relating to funding for the course, how the course and the Chair(s) are funded, by who, how and the budget as well as who is teaching these courses during the 2024-2025 academic year. Records responsive to this request include, without limitation, Programs of Instruction, Course Outline, Course Syllabus, Instructor martials, presentations of any kind, Learning and Training Objective(s), course instructor packets, testing materials, emails, notes, schedules, approved or disapproved attendees, handouts, quizzes and tests and all other related to the planning and conduct of the course(s).

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Mangione (California Highway Patrol)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Mangione (California Highway Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From January 1, 2023 to the time this request is processed:
* Any internal or external communications -- including emails, text messages, and memoranda -- mentioning "Mangione" OR "Luigi Mangione"
* Any memoranda, records, missing person reports, police reports, or incident reports mentioning "Mangione" OR "Luigi Mangione"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available.

If there are any questions about my request, can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me at emailcarolinehaskins@gmail.com. I am also happy to hop on the phone.

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a freelance reporter writing for outlets such as WIRED, The Guardian, and Rolling Stone. As such, the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request.

Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires and an even more prompt reply if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question.

Best,
Caroline Haskins

title: PLRA & EEOC 28 CFR § 39.170 for federal prisoners with disabilities (Equal Employment Opportunity Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: PLRA & EEOC 28 CFR § 39.170 for federal prisoners with disabilities (Equal Employment Opportunity Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or information relating to the implementation of requiring inmates to exhaust their remedies under both the Prison Litigation Reform Act and EEOC 28 C.F.R. § 39.170 before they can bring a claim under the Rehabilitation Act. 

Any records or information relating to the creation of the 28 CFR § 39.170 for federal inmates bringing conditions of confinement claims relating to disabilities. 

Any grievances or complaints by inmates regarding the double exhaustion requirement of the PLRA and EEOC in order to bring a Rehabilitation Act claim. 

Any meeting minutes, memorada, press releases, releases, MOUs, etc. that discuss inmates required exhaustion of remedies under the PLRA and 28 CFR § 39.170.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Richards

title: Special Confinement Unit at USP Terre Haute

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Special Confinement Unit at USP Terre Haute
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or information related to the housing of inmates sentenced to death to the Special Confinement Unit ("death row") at USP Terre Haute. This includes information and records pertaining to the creation of the Special Confinement Unit, why the Special Confinement Unit was created, when the Special Confinement Unit was created, the current procedures that govern the Special Confinement Unit, and any other administrative information pertaining to the Special Confinement Unit. 

Any records or information related to inmate grievances and/or complaints regarding the Special Confinement Unit for death sentenced inmates at USP Terre Haute.

Any communications or correspondences between, to, or from the Bureau of Prisons, Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Investigation, and the Central Intelligence agency pertaining to the Special Confinement Unit at USP Terre Haute.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Richards

title: Prattville, Alabama parade denial

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Prattville, Alabama parade denial
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications to or from Mayor Bill Gillespie concerning the Prattville Pride float in the 2024 Prattville Christmas parade. This includes any communications mentioning any of the following terms: pride, parade, lgbtq, lgbt, gay, homosexual, or drag.

2. Any records reflecting any cancellations (or requests to cancel) any float in the 2024 Prattville Christmas parade.

3. Any communications to or from, or incident reports by, the Prattville Police Department concerning the 2024 Prattville Christmas parade.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all internal FBI circulars or bulletins, released during the last five years (2020-2024), listing or describing contacts with the entertainment industry or entertainment products supported by the FBI.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." title: Request to Air Force for all internal circulars of bulletins pertaining to entertainment industry products from 2020-2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Air Force for all internal circulars of bulletins pertaining to entertainment industry products from 2020-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all internal US Air Force circulars or bulletins, released during the last five years (2020-2024), listing or describing contacts with the entertainment industry or entertainment products supported by the Air Force.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Records on OSC Cases Related to Office of the Special Counsel.  DI-25-000310 DI-25-000325 DI-25-000379

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records on OSC Cases Related to Office of the Special Counsel.  DI-25-000310 DI-25-000325 DI-25-000379
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act Request
Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Records on OSC Cases Related to Office of the Special Counsel.  DI-25-000310 DI-25-000325 DI-25-000379

To:
FOIA Officer
Office of the Special Counsel (OSC)
1730 M Street, N.W., Suite 218
Washington, D.C. 20036-4505

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request the following records:

1. Comprehensive Records on Specified Cases
Complete documentation, communications, and records related to the following cases:

David Medeiros (DI) - Case Open Dates:

November 27, 2024, 7:36 AM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
November 28, 2024, 11:13 AM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
December 2, 2024, 8:00 AM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
December 3, 2024, 2:30 PM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
December 5, 2024, 9:11 AM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
December 6, 2024, 12:33 PM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
December 7, 2024, 5:53 AM – Case Status: Duplicate/Add'l Info
Case Numbers and Related Details:

DI-25-000310: Closed as of November 25, 2024
DI-25-000325: Closed as of November 27, 2024
DI-25-000379: Closed as of December 9, 2024

Pattern of Non-Compliance by the Office of Special Counsel (OSC)
I must emphasize that the OSC has repeatedly and willfully failed to comply with clearly outlined ADA accommodation requests, including:

Failure to Identify FOIA Officers: OSC has continually failed to disclose the names, titles, and roles of FOIA officers and decision-makers responsible for processing previous requests. This omission is concerning and raises significant issues regarding transparency, accountability, and compliance with FOIA mandates.

These repeated failures directly violate the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Rehabilitation Act, and FOIA transparency requirements. It is imperative that the OSC address these concerns immediately and provide the requested accommodations without further obstruction.

2. Records to Include
Case Files: All records related to OSC’s review, processing, and closure of the above cases.
Correspondence: Internal and external communications (emails, directives, meeting notes) involving OSC personnel handling these cases.
Rationale for Case Status: Specific records detailing the decisions to mark cases as "Duplicate/Add'l Info" or to close them, with supporting documentation.
Referrals: Any communications or referrals made to other agencies concerning these cases.
Timeframe
This request covers records from November 1, 2024, to the present to ensure comprehensive inclusion of all case-related materials.

ADA Compliance
I require all records to be provided in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Please ensure:

Communication via MuckRock Platform:

All responses, updates, and records must be delivered exclusively via Muckrock. No physical mail, phone calls, external links, passwords or portal-based responses.
Direct Text in Email Body:
Provide summarized responses directly in the email body for accessibility.
Screen-Reader-Compatible PDFs:
Attachments must be clearly labeled, properly formatted, and fully accessible.
Simplified Summaries:
Include plain-language summaries for complex or technical records to aid comprehension.

Legal Basis for Request
1. FOIA Compliance (5 U.S.C. § 552)
FOIA mandates full and timely disclosure of requested records unless exemptions explicitly apply.
Any redactions or withholdings must include detailed statutory citations (5 U.S.C. § 552(b)) and clear explanations.
2. ADA Compliance (42 U.S.C. § 12132; 28 C.F.R. § 35.160)
Public entities must ensure effective communication with individuals with disabilities. Accessible document formatting and accommodations are legally required.
3. Whistleblower Protection
As the cases directly involve whistleblower disclosures and protections, prompt access to these records is critical to ensure transparency and accountability under 5 U.S.C. § 2302(b)(8).
Fee Waiver Request
This request is not for commercial purposes. I request a waiver of all fees under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), as disclosure of these records serves the public interest in promoting transparency, whistleblower protection, and ADA compliance.

Expedited Processing Request
Expedited processing is requested under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) based on:

Significant Public Interest: The implications for systemic accountability and whistleblower protections.
Urgency: Timely transparency is necessary to address ongoing ADA compliance concerns and retaliation claims.
Identification of Personnel
Please include the names, titles, and roles of all FOIA officers, decision-makers, and supervisory personnel involved in processing this request for transparency and accountability.

Delivery and Response
Acknowledge receipt of this request within five (5) business days.
Provide requested records within the statutory timeframe.
For any denials or partial redactions, include detailed justifications, appeal instructions, and the name of the reviewing authority.
Consequences of Non-Compliance
Failure to comply with FOIA or ADA requirements may result in:

Administrative Oversight: Filing of formal complaints with the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS).
Legal Action: Pursuit of remedies under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(B) and 42 U.S.C. § 12133.
Public Advocacy: Escalation through media and public channels to ensure accountability.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources, LLC
DB.42.131.Inf.

​

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA-2025-060
communications.communication:
Pattern of Non-Compliance by the Office of Special Counsel (OSC)
I  must emphasize that the OSC has repeatedly and willfully failed to comply with clearly outlined ADA accommodation requests, including:

****** Failure to Identify FOIA Officers: OSC has continually failed to disclose the names, titles, and roles of FOIA officers and decision-makers responsible for processing previous requests. This omission is concerning and raises significant issues regarding transparency, accountability, and compliance with FOIA mandates.

These repeated failures directly violate the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Rehabilitation Act, and FOIA transparency requirements. It is imperative that the OSC address these concerns immediately and provide the requested accommodations without further obstruction.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
DB.42.131.Inf. https://www.ctbraininjury.com/blog/tags/db-42-131-inf

communications.subject: MEDEIROS FOIA-2025-060
communications.communication:
U.S. OFFICE OFSPECIAL COUNSEL 1730 M Street, N.W.,Suite 218 Washington, DC20036-4505 (202) 804-7000 
Greetings DAVID MEDEIROS , Thank you forcontacting the U.S. Office of Special Counsel (OSC). This email is in responseto your request which was received by the OSC. You requested that OSC provideyou with information pertaining to Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C.section 552 records. OSC processed your request under the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C.section 552a, and the FOIA. OSC is an independentFederal Agency. Our primary mission is to safeguard the merit system byprotecting federal employees and applicants from prohibited personnelpractices, especially reprisal for whistleblowing. Your request seeks recordsthat, if they exist, would have been created or compiled by another federalagency or agencies. OSC does not maintain records for other agencies. Since your request doesnot seek access to OSC records, OSC has not conducted a search for the recordsyou requested. Accordingly, we are closing your request . If you have anyquestions regarding this request, please feel free to contact us at202-804-7000 or via email at foiarequest@osc.gov . 
Kind regards, OSC FOIA Team

communications.subject: Expedite Determination FOIA-2025-060
communications.communication:
U.S. OFFICE OF SPECIAL COUNSEL 1730 M Street, N.W., Suite 218 Washington, DC 20036-4505 (202) 804-7000 Dear DAVID MEDEIROS: Please be advised that the U.S. Office of Special Counsel received your FOIA request for processing.  In your request you have asked for an expedited determination.  We apply OSC’s Expedited Processing Procedures at 5 C.F.R. §1820.4 as follows:   
 Failure to obtain requested records on an expedited basis could reasonably be expected to pose an imminent threat to the life or physical safety of an individual (this usually applies to individual’s requesting their own investigative case file);  
 
  *  
 With respect to a request made by a person primarily engaged in disseminating information, an urgency exists to inform the public about an actual or alleged federal government activity ( this usually applies to members of the media); or  
 
  *  
 The requested records relate to an appeal for which the requester faces an imminent deadline for filing with the Merit Systems Protection Board (MSPB) or other administrative tribunal or a court of law, seeking personal relief pursuant to a complaint filed by the requester with OSC , or referred to OSC pursuant to title 38 of the U.S. Code (this usually applies when we receive proof of an imminent deadline).  Please provide proof for the basis to expedite your request Thank you, Jennifer Wheeler FOIA Program Specialist U.S. Office of Special Counsel 1730 M Street, N.W., Suite 218|Washington, DC 20036-4505 Tel: (214) 974-7074| Fax: (202) 254-3711| jwheeler@osc.gov

title: Bruce Plesser, Case #GP22-13114

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Bruce Plesser, Case #GP22-13114
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Crash report date: 8/3/2022
All documents from Pinellas County and Fl Highway Patrol
any investigatory notes taken on the date of the alleged accident
-any alcohol or drug tests administered to the driver on that day
-any photos or interviews taken at the scene of the accident, including but not limited to the street, the car, the scene of impact, injuries to both parties, and witness statements of movements of both parties leading up to event
-interviews related to statements given The Gabber
-witness statements explaining exactly what happened, how this occurred, why so much force was applied in a low speed area, why 911 wasn’t called initially, how long it took for an ambulance to arrive, a step by step recreation of what occurred when help finally arrived, and then a detailed description of the accident and investigation, including the speed of impact, the damage to the car, the driver’s state of mind, conditions of the road, and the Highway Patrol’s investigation (as my father died)
-any communications between police and driver regarding investigation
-any discussions between police and Press
-any discussions between police and hospital, including but not limited to my fathers phone, his history of alcoholism, and disposal of his body
-any communications regarding or about my father's stolen phone (used to get my # as he lay dying) and then, despite my saying to the hospital the phone had to be locked up, was then stolen off his cold dead body
-any communications about the decision to cremate without autopsy against my wishes
-any internal communications with other FL agencies or with any member of my former defense
-any emails or texts or internal documents either within Pinellas County formally or informally 2 weeks prior to the event to present that discusses my father or this event directly or indirectly.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Sam

title: IRB documents related to the study published in JAMA, doi:10.1001/jama.2024.2424

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IRB documents related to the study published in JAMA, doi:10.1001/jama.2024.2424
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, memoranda, e-mails, and reports issued or received by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) related to the NIH Study: Pierpaoli. Neuroimaging Findings in US Government Personnel and Their Family Members Involved in Anomalous Health Incidents. JAMA. Published March 18, 2024. doi:10.1001/jama.2024.2424

Besides the doi address above, a web link to the study is https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2816532 and the file of the published study is attached to this FOIA request.

Documents, memoranda, e-mails, and reports issued by or received by the IRB  related to the study should be collected from January 1, 2017 until December 9, 2024.

Request for Expedited Processing

I am filing this request in my role as a Board Member for Targeted Justice, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, and a news organization. Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2). Targeted Justice currently has over 16,000 subscribers and over 130,000 thousand views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.

Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).

Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Len Ber MD
Global Medical Leader
Board Member
Targeted Justice, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization

417 Cardinal Dr.
Bloomingdale, IL 60108

Ph: 630-450-7014
e-mail: lenber@protonmail.com
Website: www.TargetedJustice.com

title: Facility vacancy rates, 2013-2024

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Facility vacancy rates, 2013-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Security, non-security, COI & corporal, and total vacancy rates for each facility from July 2013 to July 2024. If possible, please provide the vacancy rates for each month during this period. 

If any of these data are not available, please provide what is available (for instance, total vacancy rates or annual rates by facility). 

Thank you for your assistance with this request. Please do not hesitate to contact for questions or clarifications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Ben Goehring.

title: Body Camera Footage *Urgent Request*

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Body Camera Footage *Urgent Request*
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera (audio and video) footage from June 1, 2023 to October  1, 2023, where individuals were charged with resisting arrest, shoplifting, or offenses involving serious physical harm, such as - but not limited to - aggravated assault, homicide, or the use of a firearm.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Body Cam Review
